subject: Business
title: Retention Beats Acquisition
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Retention Beats Acquisition.

hook.text: A company spent $10M on ads and grew 40%. Then they cut churn by 5% and grew 80%.

buildup.text: Acquiring a new customer costs 5 to 25 times more than retaining an existing one.

discovery.text: High retention compounds: a 5% improvement can boost profits by 25 to 95% over time.

twist.text: Startups celebrate signups while quietly losing users out the back door. Vanity metrics hide decay.

climax.text: Amazon Prime locks in retention through bundled value: free shipping, streaming, and deals.

punchline.text: Stop pouring water into a leaky bucket. Fix the bucket.

quiz.question: Why is retention often more valuable than acquisition?
options: Retaining customers is far cheaper and compounds over time
